thread.title: 'Let's have a name!': Will.i.am causes Emma Willis to panic on The Voice as he struggles to save act
thread.title_full: 'Let's have a name!': Will.i.am causes Emma Willis to panic on The Voice as he struggles to save act

author: JJ Nattrass
title: 'Let's have a name!': Will.i.am causes Emma Willis to panic on The Voice as he struggles to save act
text:
Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
He's a creative genius, whose bagged a number of hits in his time - both as a solo artist and in a group. 
But it would seem that snap-decisions are Will.i.am's forte, as the star, 41 struggled to choose between four of his acts on Saturday night's The Voice. 
Having been left to decide which would join Jason and Michelle - saved by the public - in the final rounds, the indecisive Scream & Shout singer caused a panic; eventually resulting in an exasperated Emma Willis shouting: "Let's have a name!" Read More The Voice's Gavin Rossdale leaves fans divided as he performs with band Bush on the show Any good in a crisis, Will? (Photo: ITV Picture Desk) 
As Will struggled to pick between hopefuls, Tanya, Lia, Hayley, Clara, he wriggled around his chair as he tried to come up with an answer. 
Gurning, grinning and grimacing, Will was pushed by host Emma to decide, as the minutes started to tick down on the live show's remaining air time. 
Apparently having decided, he said : "This is for the show and has nothing to do with how I feel about you as an artist." Read More Will.i.am had to make a TOUGH decision in The Voice knockout stage as his six acts became three Emma Willis was left hurrying him, seemingly exasperated by his indecision on Saturday (Photo: Rex Features) 
However, it seem he wasn't able to choose and he paused yet again, before trying to foist the decision on his fellow mentor, Jennifer Hudson. 
"Hold on! I’m going to let Jennifer pick," he shouted, as the four girls looked on dismayed at his inability to put them out of their misery. 
But as Emma and Jennifer object, and Emma seemingly almost lost her cool, he mumbled that he'd picked Tanya. Will struggled to pick his third and final act, and even tried to foist the decision onto Jennifer Hudson (Photo: Rex Features) 
Asked to repeat his decision, Will confirmed that he'd picked Tanya, and with only seconds to sapre a flustered Emma gathered Will's chosen for a VERY brief video outro. 
It was certainly a dramatic way to end what had been a series of knock-out performances to decided his final three. 
Jason and Michelle were saved in the public vote, but it was up to Will to save his third and final singer going into the final. Read More Will.i.am is returning for the Voice 2018 - and he'd be 'hurt' if Tom Jones wasn't there too It came after a series of stand-out performance as his acts were chopped from six to three (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Keeping the audience on tenterhooks, and even winding -up Emma Willis with his inability to make a tough decision, the show stalwart whispered after an agonising few minutes that Tanya was hi pick. 
That meant that a devastated, Lia, Hayley and Clara were kicked out of the competition - though Will declared: "This is for the show and has nothing to do with how I feel about you as an artist." 
And it's certainly easy to see how Will found it so hard to choose, as all six acts gave the judges food for thought in the show. Read More The Voice audience member whisked across London by Scarlett Moffatt to take best seats on Saturday Night Takeaway Tanya, Jason and Michelle were revealed to be Will's final three (Photo: ITV) 
Kicking things off first on the live show was Tanya, who sung a powerful rendition of Sigma and Paloma Faith's Changing - wowing all four mentors. 
While Will could barely express his regret at having not turned around for the talented songwriter in the first stage of the show, he declared she'd done him proud on the night. 
Gavin Rossdale appeared blown-away by the song, and declared he'd become "emotionally invested" in it. Tanya was spell-binding (Photo: Rex Features) 
Jennifer Hudson was in agreement, as was Sir Tom Jones, who declared she'd given a "professional performance". 
Next up was Hayley Eccles, who was given I Need You Now by Lady Antebellum to perform. 
Improving with every outing, the hopeful was heaped with praise - though the mentors help back with heaps of praise. 
"I love how she can take something and put her own direction into it," gushed Will following the song. Hayley's rendition of I Need You Now left some mentors wanting a little more (Photo: Rex Features) 
Tom gave her some guidance following her effort, telling Hayley: "You could get a little looser, you did really well though." 
Likewise, Gaven said: "I hear what Tom is saying. I think the audience really helped you." 
Though he added encouragingly: "every time you keep getting better and better." 
Jason Jones, Will's only male act left, was next up on the stage, and gave Arian Grande's Into You his very own spin. Jason blew all four mentors away (Photo: Rex Features) 
Blown away by the song, Will exclaimed: "You’re voice is so incredible. if i had a voice like yours i would sing with no shirt on." 
And an admiring Tom said Jason had only got "stronger", while Jennifer praised him for his "own unique smoothness". 
Following the glowing praise, Jason himself said: "That was the best feeling." 
Lia White performed Cyndi Lauper's Girls Just Want To Have Fun, putting an acoustic spin on the '80s classic. Lia White was unsure about her stunning cover of Girls Just Want To Have Fun (Photo: Rex Features) 
After being initially unsure about Will's pick, she was heaped with praise - with Jennifer in particular giving her huge kudos. 
She said: "You are so adorable. you remind me of Solange [Knowles], and I don’t know if you know who Aliyah is, but you remind me of her." 
And Gavin was an equally big fan, simply stating: "It’s been done to death, and you were really smart to do it your own way. In the short time you were on stage you went from super intimate to busting wicked moves." Clara Hurtado gave a sizzling performance, owning the stage with Alarm by Anne Marie (Photo: Rex Features) 
Clara Hurtado gave a stand-out performance with Alarm by Anne Marie, but it wasn't just her voice wowing - as her stage presence bowled the judges over. 
"That dress and the way you sang that, that is fire," panted Will after the exhilarating number. 
Even host Emma Willis was unable to hide her admiration either, as she chirped" she’s so hot. 
Gavin added that "she is the entire package", before adding: "You look incredible, you sound great… it’s just so special. Will is right, the red dress is special." Despite battling against illness, Michelle managed to deliver a powerhouse act (Photo: Rex Features) 
"I think it’s all been said. I loved it," gushed Tom. In response a humble Clara said: "I was so nervous, so im glad that i powered through it." 
Michelle was the last act up, singing Bonnie Ray's I Can't Make You Love Me, but was nervous as a bad throat had been plaguing her all week. 
She needn't have worried though as she received a standing ovation from the audience. 
Tom declared that he "really loved" the song, while Gavin said: "You’ve got this split personality. You have this tension when you come to rehearsals. You should know that when you come through- for you, your voice is extraordinary." 
While will told her: "That performance felt like a lifetime of what people should be seeing." Like us on Facebook
